intro: Ligularia pojarkovana, commonly known as the Pojarkov's ligularia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
